solution_line_template: The cost of each pair of jeans is ${shirt_price} x {jeans_price_multiplier} = $<<{shirt_price}*{jeans_price_multiplier}={jeans_price}>>{jeans_price}.
So {num_jeans} pairs of jeans amount to ${jeans_price} x {num_jeans} = $<<{jeans_price}*{num_jeans}={jeans_total}>>{jeans_total}.
Therefore, the store will earn ${shirts_total} + ${jeans_total} = $<<{shirts_total}+{jeans_total}={total_earnings}>>{total_earnings} if all shirts and jeans are sold.
